entry.title: Combined summary - 0.4 Release Candidate 2
entry.summary: The discussion on the BitcoinTalk forum revolves around several issues related to Bitcoin. One user, ThiagoCMC, expresses their preference for a feature that generates a new Bitcoin address every time they receive cryptocurrency. They use dynamic addresses randomly following the moon phase and label them accordingly. John Smith asks for their rationale behind tracking all of their Bitcoin addresses. Another user, Martinx, expresses their appreciation for an automatic address generation feature. However, JS explains that most people prefer to create new receiving addresses themselves and label them to avoid confusion and uncertainty about unlabeled addresses' purposes.In September 2011, Gavin Andresen announced the tagging of the git tree (v0.4.00rc2) and listed a few fixes from release candidate 1, including optimization of database writes for transactions with numerous inputs, fixing a potential problem with duplicate, unspendable coinbase transactions if keypool keys ran out while generating bitcoins with a locked wallet, and resolving a deadlock that could occur when adding addresses from 'addr' messages and IRC. The bitcoin-ubuntu-v0.4.00rc2.zip and bitcoin-win32-v0.4.00rc2.zip files were available for download at http://dl.dropbox.com/u/29653426/, along with their SHA1s.Some users posted in the BitcoinTalk forum expressing their appreciation for an automatic address generation feature and asking about its future inclusion, but others preferred to create new receiving addresses themselves and label them to avoid confusion and uncertainty about unlabeled addresses' purposes. ThiagoCMC suggested leaving the feature as an option but disabled by default and including an explanation for increasing anonymity. The discussion also touches on concerns about anonymity and labeling Bitcoin addresses.Another post by Gavin Andresen announces the release of v0.4.00rc2, which includes several fixes from the previous release candidate. Finally, one user experienced issues when closing Bitcoin with network issues, and the program displayed a message indicating an "UNKNOWN EXCEPTION." In summary, the discussion on the BitcoinTalk forum covers various topics related to Bitcoin, including address generation, anonymity concerns, labeling Bitcoin addresses, and software updates.
